Based on the search results, I found information about a musical adaptation of Reymont's "Chłopi" (The Peasants). Here's what I discovered:

## Musical Adaptation of "Chłopi" by Władysław Reymont

The musical adaptation is based on Władysław Reymont's Nobel Prize-winning novel from the early 20th century. The story shows community life over a period of four seasons of the year, and focuses on the conflict of generations, inevitability of change and the impact of a group on the individual.

### Production Details

This magnificent Polish musical was directed by Wojciech Kościelniak and premiered in 2013. The production was staged at the Teatr Muzyczny (Musical Theatre) in Gdynia, not at Teatr Narodowy as suggested in the search query.

### Cast and Performances

Bernard Szyc, a flagship figure of the Musical Theatre in Gdynia, played Maciej Boryna. Karolina Trębacz and Renia Gosławska performed in two completely different interpretations of the character Jagna.

The production featured breathtaking group dance scenes with up to 60 artists performing simultaneously, and showcased the diversity of human characters surrounded by Łowicz colors, costumes and music.

### Critical Reception

The musical received positive reviews, with critics comparing it to "Les Misérables" - one reviewer called it "Polish 'Les Misérables'". Another review noted that this Gdynia production would go down in the history of Polish theatre.

While the search didn't reveal any specific adaptations at Teatr Narodowy or opera versions, it did show this successful musical theatre adaptation that has been well-received in Polish theatre circles.
